From the Publishers Blurb
The Rifter® #67 is about adventure and monsters. Plus news, coming attractions, and more.
Every issue of The Rifter® is an idea factory for players and Game Masters to generate new ideas, and find new avenues of adventure. It provides useful, ready to go, source material you can just drop into your ongoing games. A doorway to new possibilities and numerous Palladium role-playing worlds. And the many new characters, O.C.C.s, powers, magic, weapons, villains, monsters, adventures and ideas for one setting can be easily adapted to any Palladium setting. boardgame.name: Untrusted
boardgame.description:
A meta-JavaScript adventure game by Alex Nisnevich and Greg Shuflin.

Untrusted —or— the Continuing Adventures of Dr. Eval is an exciting Meta-Javascript Adventure Game wherein you guide the dashing, steadfast Dr. Eval through a mysterious MACHINE CONTINUUM, wherein, using only his trusty computer and the TURING-COMPLETE power of Javascript, he must literally ALTER HIS REALITY in order to find his freedom! You must literally edit and re-execute the very Javascript running the game in your browser to save Dr. Eval from this dark and confusing reality!

Overview

The game presents you with a roguelike-like playing environment and a console window with the JavaScript code generating each level. As loaded, each level is unbeatable, and most of the JavaScript is blocked from editing. The challenge is to open a path to the next level using only the limited tools left open to you.

Source: The Developer Website.

From Wikipedia,

Voltron: Defender of the Universe is a twin stick shooter adventure game based on the Voltron television series, developed by Behaviour Interactive and published by THQ. The game was released on November 29, 2011 for the PlayStation Network and released on November 30, 2011 for the Xbox Live Arcade. The game allows players to play as all five lions from the series and to control Voltron, a huge robot formed by combining those lions. The game received mixed reception among critics. boardgame.name: Neo Geo X
Neo Geo X Gold Limited Edition
NGX
boardgame.description:
The Neo Geo X is a handheld video game console manufactured by Tommo Inc., licensed by SNK Playmore and the latest console released as part of the company's Neo Geo brand. Information about the Neo Geo X was first reported in January 2012 and later confirmed in March. It is the first Neo Geo system to be released since the discontinuation of the brand in 2004 and the third Neo Geo handheld device, following the 1999 release of the Neo Geo Pocket Color, which was supported until 2001.

The system was released on December 18, 2012 as part of a bundle called the "Neo Geo X Gold Limited Edition", which includes a docking station, an arcade stick, and a bonus game card. The docking station is modelled after the original Neo Geo AES console and is used for charging the handheld as well as connecting it to a television. The arcade stick is a replica of the original Neo Geo AES arcade stick that can be used as a controller when the handheld is connected to a TV through the docking station.

It features games that were on the original Neo Geo AES/MVS hardware and comes built-in with 20 original Neo Geo games. Additional titles are available on game cards.

Source: Wikipedia, "Neo Geo X", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Guspira, el joc dels correfocs
boardgame.description:
Guspira is a funny, quick and suitable board game for all ages, inspired on the world of fire, devils, beasts and everything related to a ‘correfoc’, one of the most gorgeous and spectacular fests of the Catalan culture. Among the game cards there are some characteristic elements of this celebration as ‘Drac’, ‘Víbria’, ‘Guita’, Devils or ‘Tabalers’, without forgetting ‘correfocaires’, brave people who jump and dance under the fire.

The main objective is to win the maximum number of ‘correfocaires’ playing the pyrotechnic cards from the hand. But it is not always as easy as it seems to be, the dice has also its role…

Besides the playful side, Guspira is expected to be a way of promotion for the Catalan culture. The cards show the most characteristic elements of this celebration and they have no text in order to be played anywhere in the world.

boardgame.name: Elite Encounters Role-Playing Game
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Elite Encounters Rulebook will be a single-edition book containing everything you will need to organise and play a roleplaying game in the setting of the Elite universe.

It will be available in a variety of formats, both electronic and hardcopy.

Contents

Although the final contents of the book have not yet been set in stone, the general content will be:

Character Generation Rules, including blank character sheets, ship stats and ship record sheets
Gameplay Rules, including a single page (pullout) rules summary
Miniatures Rules, including card model miniatures, measuring devices for movement and combat and card model 6-sided dice
Background information on the Elite Universe
Character and NPC Templates
3 Sample Adventures, including pregenerated player characters, set in a region developed specifically for the RPG and featured in the computer game Elite: Dangerous!
If we can fit any more content into the book then we will!

Illustrations

The book will be richly illustrated using the work of a variety of people. Frontier Developments PLC have made their catalogue of Elite Dangerous concept art available and will allow the use of in-game footage from Alpha and Beta builds of the game prior to the full release.

In addition Daftworks will be creating custom artwork and an independent artist will be providing illustrations.

Developed in Collaboration with Frontier

The RPG will be developed in close association with Frontier Developments PLC, allowing the author unprecedented access to the resources of the computer game that forms the foundation for this book. The universe of Elite is broad and detailed and Frontier themselves are creating huge amounts of background and history for their new game - Daftworks have exclusive early access to this information as well as having a small part in providing background material and being involved with creating a "writer's bible" for the authors releasing books with Elite: Dangerous.

This means that we are on the front line for any background information that is developed, and as much of that as possible will be included in the book.

Due to this collaboration we are hoping to add more rich content, including:

World Guide for selected gameplay area of space
Map of the Core systems for each organisation
Large-scale map of the galaxy

boardgame.name: Medieval Academy: Espansione Galanteria & Magia
Medieval Academy: Expansion «Gallantry» and «Magic»
boardgame.description:
This is a Medieval Academy expansion. These variants require the Medieval Academy game. All the basic rules apply except for the modifications described in the rules that come with this expansion. You can play in the same time with as many variants as you want.

This expansion is a single board with 'Gallantry' on one side and 'Magic' on the other.

Gallantry Board
In disc’s order on the Gallantry side of the board, each squire chooses and applies one or two bonus. He places his disc on chosen bonuses,in order to make those bonus unavailable for the others squires. On less than 4 squires games, only first and second squires earn bonus.

Magic Board
As on Gallantry board, on Magic board, squires don’t directly win Chivalry points, but Magic board allows them to move forward on any board. On scoring, (turns 2 and 5, after Gallantry scoring), only the 3 first ranked squires (or the 2 first ranked in 3 players games) earn cases bonus; they could move forward their own discs by a number of cases according to their position on Magic board. The move can be split on one or several boards.

Move order:
1)First, the 3rd ranked squire on Magic board.
2)After the 2nd ranked squire on Magic board.
3)Finally, the first ranked squire on Magic board.

There is a reminder on the top of the Magic board:
At the end of Turn 2, after the scoring phase, all the discs go back to square 0 on Magic board.

boardgame.name: Butim
boardgame.description:
Butim (Spoil, in portuguese) is a competitive pirate game where players compete with each other for the best equipment, pieces of maps and hidden treasures. It's a party game of luck and strategy where you will cheat, steal, bother and disrupt the lives of your opponents. There is no honor among pirates! There is no elimination, that is, who enters the game stays until the end and everyone has a chance to win.

Butim is a card game that tells the story of the Bloody Islands Archipelago. These islands were used by generations of pirates to hide the biggest secrets that sailed the 7 seas. But all the pirates who buried their treasures there, also armed the most terrible traps so that these treasures stay properly protected. It was a beautiful and deadly place. However, as every story has an end, on a beautiful day a mysterious maelstrom opened near the islands and is leaching the islands with all this wealth to the bottom of the ocean. The objective of the game is to remove as many treasures as possible from these islands before they vanish forever. The player who has more wealth at the end of the game is declared the winner.

During the game you draw resources and cards, dig the islands (draw island cards) looking for maps and treasures and play special cards. At the end of a round cards are removed from the islands to the maelstrom. The game ends when a number of islands were totally removed.

boardgame.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age with Mediterranean Expansion
boardgame.description:
Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age, a sequel to the highly-awarded Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age, lets you build an Iron Age civilization in under an hour! Do you build provinces, raise armies, and conquer barbarians or build ports and ships to gain trade goods? Explore the strategies of Greece, Phoenicia, and Rome as you erect monuments, fend off disasters, and strive to feed your people.

Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age gives players different ways to build their empires: the Trade and Naval strategies of the Phoenicians, the conquests of Alexander the Great, and the engineering prowess and gradual absorption of new provinces by the Roman Republic.

Some copies of the game include the Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age – The Mediterranean Expansion in the base game box. The only indication of this was a sticker on the shrink that read "MED expansion" (and those boxes are heavier).

The Mediterranean expansion adds overseas settlements to the mix via a central pegboard that all players share. Players race to reap the benefits of strategic colonies: Crete for fleets; Spain for mining; Carthage for wheat; Gaul for armies; while Syracuse, the home of Archimedes, and Alexandria provide vital innovations.

The Mediterranean expansion is now available separately from Eagle Games, or as part of a new edition of the game. When sold on its own, the expansion does not contain rules or the updated score pads that include expansion scoring.

boardgame.name: Merry Christmas! The Hand-Drafting Card Game
boardgame.description:
You are a member of HOHOHO – the Helping Out & Happiness Optimization Holiday Organization - an elite group of elves operating out of Santa’s North Pole Headquarters. Your mission, if you choose to accept it, is to help Santa bring joy to all the good girls and boys. You’ll coordinate the efforts of busy workshop elves, powerful flying reindeers, and even the big man himself. Take the right actions and you’ll bring joy to the world and ensure that everyone has a Merry Christmas!

Each player drafts a hand of twelve actions, ten of which will be played throughout the game's three phases. Elves are used in the Workshop Phase to craft toys from the list. Reindeer are used during the Sleigh Phase to ensure the toys are delivered to excited children. Items are placed in the Tree Phase to elevate the atmosphere of joy and wonder. Santa makes frequent appearances throughout the game, offering his help along the way. As Christmas comes to a close, players are scored based on the toys delivered and the joy those toys inspire.

boardgame.name: The Physicist
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the third installment of the Advancing with Class series. This supplement focuses on a brand new class: The Physicist. A spell caster like no other, with the ability to spontaneously become stronger, more enduring, or more agile as well as pass these enhancments off to others.

Why should only the more intellectual or spirital characters have access to casting magic spells? What if you could use your Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution to power your own set of magics? The Physicist is a new class that allows your character to focus on one of his physical attributes to empower magics to give the party the edge when it comes to dealing with more powerful creatures.

Sure, you can’t cast a Fireball, but who needs to when you have the strength of a Giant or the indomitable spirit of a Dragon? And not only that, you can share this power with your friends and allies.

Included is the Physicist class, a Psionic version of the Physicist, several archetypes, new spells, and feats. Welcome to the magics of Physic!

boardgame.name: Haunted Mansion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It never was the same after the Earl died. The Mansion lay empty and abandoned... except for strange sounds and lights in the night

Haunted Mansion is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Haunted Mansion is a multiple level set, comprising 4 battlemaps. The main map features a large stone mansion, with dusty and cobwebbed furniture. Stairs lead down to the cellar where a you are as likely to find a coffin as you are barrels. Upstairs are bedrooms, mysterious blood stains and moonlight, and another set of stairs lead to the attic.

Haunted Mansion is ideal for countless adventures. If you're planning a Halloween or Horror story, your adventurers can see if the stories of a Haunting are true. Vampires, ghouls and ghosts are just a few of the denizens you may encounter in the Haunted Mansion.

. Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

boardgame.name: Missing Mythic Magic Volume XI
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Uncover Forgotten Arcane Lore!

Everyone knows that knowledge is power, and that having options is better than not having them. It should come as no surprise, then, that wizards, witches, and other powerful spellcasters are always on the lookout for new and exciting spells to add to their repertoires. While many spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook received a facelift and an upgrade in Mythic Adventures, the sourcebook that introduced mythic power to the game of Pathfinder, dozens of spells were left behind. Missing Mythic Magic Volume XI, and its predecessors, aim to give each and every spell from the core rules a full-fledged mythic upgrade, all the way from A to Z, with a special focus on making mythic spells that feel as over-the-top and larger-than-life as possible.

This installment includes 20 mythic spells, from heroes’ feast to imprisonment. A mythic hide from animals can ward an entire area against animals, rather than affecting individuals, and expands the spell to work on magical beasts, plants, oozes, and vermin. A mythic hold person can be rendered permanent (if the DC is high enough), effectively paralyzing the victim indefinitely, while a mythic horrid wilting causes the desiccated corpses of those that it slays to rise a mummies under the caster’s control. This tome contains all that, and much, much more!

boardgame.name: You Must Escape (Web Browser)
boardgame.description:
User Summary

You Must Escape is a game where you are locked in a room, and must find your way out. However the lights are turned off and you must use the sound your footsteps make and the louder sound you make with the space bar. These send soundwaves traveling out that you can see represented by white lines on the screen. Things are easy at first, but then you will see red lines bouncing back at you denoting danger. It might be a simple stationary trap, or it could be a creature hunting you. But beware, if you can "see" the creature by making noise, that means the creature has heard you too!

boardgame.name: Uruk II: Promo card Monarchy
Uruk II: Promokarte Monarchie
boardgame.description:
Promo card Monarchy from the german magazine "Spielerei" issue no. 105 (Oct.-Dec. 2014)
The achievement Monarchy has a new edge with black color. It is the only achievement of level 5. No black card may be replaced by an achievement. Black cards are not immune from the effects of disasters. In addition to a black card no settlement can be set because the resources are not available. The favor of Nergal does not help on black cards. However, it is possible to set settlements in front of black cards by using the "scale". A black card can replace an achievement that has upside a village or town. Black cards don't count as a color within the meaning of the condition of civilization cards (eg. "disease").
To play a black card, the player needs either more black cards or a corresponding number of color pairs or the favor Nannars. Playing "monarchy" also has to be considered the rule of stages, ie it must already be an achievement of level 4.

Function of the Monarchy promo-card:
With the promo card "monarchy" lying ahead the player receives one additional victory point.

boardgame.name: Race to Baghdad: 2003
boardgame.description:
Drive on Baghdad: 2003 is a solitaire game in which the player takes command of Central Command Forces during Operation Iraqi Freedom. Your goal is to defeat Saddam Hussein’s forces in such a manner as to prevent a post-campaign insurgency from breaking out.

The system plays the Iraqis. You will have to deal with a variety of situations, such as: battling Republican Guard divisions, safeguarding your lines of supply, sandstorms, etc., all the while keeping up the momentum in your drive on Baghdad.

The game has two levels: Standard Rules, which give a quick-play game, and the Optional Rules, which add more realism at the expense of increased complexity.

While this is a solitaire game, more than one can play as a team, making decisions by consensus, or with different players managing operations along each vector of Advance.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters

Modern War #20 - Nov Dec 2015

User Summary

You are a vampire, trying to reach your coffin in this roguelike game. You can move one hexagon a turn. But beware, so do the humters move a hexagon a turn. Stay in the shadows. Each round you can select one upgrade.

boardgame.name: Throwdown at the North Pole (Savage Worlds)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The workshops are closed, Santa off on his journey. But there’s no rest for the elves.
Santa’s mortal enemies, the abominable snowmen, attack each year as soon as the big man is gone. With hearts as cold as ice, they tear apart the gingerbread houses and toss theelves around, hoping to cause enough pain and destruction to ruin Christmas the following year.

But the North Pole is not defenseless. One person rallies the elves each year. One person trains with them in combat techniques and tactics. One person personally leads them in battle for one night each year to insure her husband can deliver toys to children next Christmas. That’s right; the leader of the elves is none other than Mrs. Claus, one of the most formidable holiday warriors on the planet.

This great module, written by Clint Black, is a light-hearted look at the question of what happens when Santa leaves with his sleigh and reindeer team each Christmas. Clint has provided Elf archetypes, loadouts and new weapons that will make this both fun and customizable. In addition, this module features a great new map from Fabled Enviroments.

boardgame.name: Battle of Golems. Learning. Programming. Robotics
Battle of Golems: Learning to Program your Robots
Battle of Golems: The Algorithmic Card Game
Битва Големов Карточная алгоритмическая игра
Битва Големов. Обучение. Программирование. Робототехника
Битва Големов. Учимся программировать роботов
boardgame.description:
The first tabletop game that allows you to simply and easily learn programming and robotics without a computer (with conditions, loop, logic, subprogram etc), and to enjoy discovering exciting strategies! For 2 to 4 players, aged 8 years and older (but played from 5-6+ ages). Training of logic, memory, team interaction - all this in a simple, but deep in content, a board game. Play at home with children, in the company, at school and use it in STEM additional education.

Welcome to the Battle of Golems! Algorythmus archmage by Cybertania’s king’s order created Golems - clay robot warriors using coal as fuel. Due to the magic crystal in its head Golem can follow commands and perform short series of them called Programs. King also ordered to build a special field, which would be used for battles between warrior programmers and their Golems. You will take part in the tournament and prove that you’re the best robot engineer of Cybertania.

In 10 rounds each player set up the Program for his Robot-Golem from Action cards and executes it. The Damage tokens and Cards of Fortune will show you how many rounds and lives remain before the victory and whether you can apply Cycles, Conditions or other Bonuses when writing the Program.

You and your opponents in each round usually have four programming slots (depending on the type of Golem), so you need to take care of a short but effective algorithm. You can use both ready-made scenarios (more then 10+ including in Scenario book) and create your own rules, fields, and actions!

Equipment:

• 5 two-sided (summer-winter) board pieces: (4 3x3 sizes and 1 4x4 size) (Print&Play includes only 1 4x4 size)
• 4 Golems figures
• 6 two-sided golem cards
• 76 action cards
• 12 Damage tokens for 4 players
• 22 two-sided obstacle (barriers) tokens + 8 logic tokens
• 40 fortune cards
• 3 Bots program cards
• Scenery book.
• Game rules.

boardgame.name: Colis Party
boardgame.description:
Try to deliver your packet as soon as possible to mailman Johnny.

Each player chooses a card (indicating means of mail delivery transport) from his hand and passes it face down to his right of left neighbour (direction is given by Johnny the mailman). When all players have a hidden card in front of them, they turn the cards at the same time. The card in front of each player indicates which combination he/she should make. They have to see how much identical cards are revealed by other players, and how much identical cards they have on their hand. This indicates on which number they have to tap (2, 3 of 4) as soon as possible. If they see 5 identical cards, they shout "timbré" (=stamped).

Players who tapped rightfully at 2, 3 of 4 can take pieces of a packet. They get 2 cards (showing parts of a postpacket) from the deck, keep 1 and discard the other one. The player who tapped the 3 can make, after choising from two cards, an additional move: steal a card from an other player. The player who could tap the 4 can choose a piece (out of two cards), steal another and gets the mailman. He/she also decides in which direction the cards are given in the next round. The players who tapped wrongfully, must discard a card from their packet.

If a player can show 5 identical cards, he shouts "timbré". He'll be the only one playing this round. He takes 5 cards from the deck, keep 1 and discard 4, steals a card and takes the mailman. The other players must discard a piece (card) of their packet.

For the next round players take the card in front of them in their hands and play a hidden card to the right or left player, as isntructed by the (new) mailman.

As soon as a player had his 6 pieces (cards) of the packet AND the mailman, he/she wins!

boardgame.name: Atum
boardgame.description:
ATUM pulls the player into a world where the player is the mechanic. It brings a novelty take on the point-and-click gameplay of previous generations and combines it with platformer puzzles. The game toys with the concept of multi-layer gameplay, dipping its layers in mathematical loops and philosophical recurrences.

The design and the aesthetics are influenced by a manifold of science fiction classics, Blade Runner and Philip K. Dick's story Martian Time Slip among others.

The game environment, used as narrative device, provides a considerable amount of references and clues that complement the underlying storyline.

ATUM has been developed by a group of 3rd year students at NHTV IGAD, The Netherlands as part of the University's Gamelab, a one-day-a-week workshop that simulates a development studio environment. The team, consisting of an average of 10 members, worked on this project for 42 days.

"You Are Here, reads the legend on that map. Which one is you? Does it matter? Your finger is a pointer on a screen."
-Gene Van Troyer

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Zombie
boardgame.description:
The Zombie is a micro-game of cunning and bluff. Taking the concept of the famous Werewolf game (Mafia), the game features some child trying to escape a zombie invasion.

Players receive a card at the start of the round and they try to eliminate the "right" player depending on their role. Players will vote each round trying to "survive" as long as possible.

The Zombie is a fast game (about 5 minutes) of bluffing and deception, it’s the perfect «filler» for any group. The game contains only 4 cards and it take less than 1 minute to explain. The game is easy to transport, does not take space and can be played almost anywhere; in queues, in a bar, in the car, during a break.

boardgame.name: Castles & Crusades Black Box Collectors Edition
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

Ten years ago we launched Castles & Crusades the RPG. We officially debuted the game at Gencon with a collectors set designed after the original white box of Dungeons & Dragons. We did this to celebrate that game's 30th anniversary.


Ten years later the game is growing stronger and faster than ever and we are happily celebrating our 10th anniversary.


To bring it in properly we present to you the 4010 Collectors Edition of Castles & Crusades, the Black Box. 10 years of C&C. 40 years of D&D. Its a wonderful world.
There are only 1000 printed.
The first 300 are signed and numbered.

Within are 3 books, 10 dice (four d6's with Castles and Crusades replacing the number 6), a small bit of company history, three cards that trace the evolution of the original company logo. These are all signed by the creators of TLG and C&C: Stephen Chenault, Davis Chenault and Mac Golden.



The three books:
Adventurer's Backpack: Four new classes: The Archer, Avatar, Magic User and Thief. Original takes on old classes! Each of the new classes is fully detailed and playable out of the box. These are followed by four ready made adventurer's backpacks, with equipment cataloged and stored, with cost and EV attached. These are followed by 36+ spells, all new, all ready to hit your table right now!


Of Gods & Monsters of Aihrde: Details on 16 or more gods, 5 giants, 5 eldritch goblins, 4 fiends and one of the Captain Kings. Each entry places the god or monster squarely in the world of Aihrde, fully playable with adventure hooks. But these are no ordinary giants and fiends. The giants are named as are the goblins, each with their own sorry tale. The fiends are wholly new to C&C, designed to aid CKs who need to bring characters to their senses!


The Golden Familiar: Revised and expanded. This adventure originally appeared as an add on with the portrait screens. Now we've cleaned it up and added 14 maps. The adventure pitches the characters a hill top castle whose 14 gates guard the only access to the treasure within.

boardgame.name: Thief Town
boardgame.description:
There Be Thieves In These Parts

Thief Town is a multiplayer-only stealth action game set in a pixel-perfect rendition of the Wild West. Lurk in the crowd, emulate non-player characters, and achieve backstabbing victory. Up to 4 players control identical avatars (the “Thieves”) in a single-screen arena (the “Town”), which is filled with other identical NPCs. Players must identify which NPCs are secretly other players and stab them for points, before being discovered and stabbed themselves!

Features


Competitive 2-4 player battles: Try to blend in with thieves while finding and stabbing other players.
A multitude of modes: Guns, smoke bombs, sheriffs, drunks, sandstorms, and more await you.
LAN & Local dynamic play: Play over LAN with up to three other players, plug in controllers to play locally, or do any combination of the two!
Cross-platform play: Play on PC, Mac, Linux, Android, or iOS devices. Any device with Thief Town installed can connect to any other device!
No menus: Connecting to other players has never been this simple!


Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Shadowrun 2050
boardgame.description:
From the English description of Shadowrun 2050

Rewind and Reload

Chrome eyes. Computers called “decks.” Big hair, big cyberlimbs and bigger guns. It’s Shadowrun in the year it all started. Take a step back to Shadowrun’s roots with Shadowrun 2050, a book that combines Fourth Edition rules—the smoothest, most accessible rule set Shadowrun has ever had—with the setting that first made the Sixth World a legend.

Shadowrun 2050 has everything players and gamemasters need to dive into the grimy beauty that kicked off one of the greatest roleplaying settings of all time. With information on how to adapt Fourth Edition Matrix, gear, and magic rules for the 2050 setting, as well as in-universe information about the powers of the world, what shadowrunners will be up to, and who they’ll be running into, Shadowrun 2050 puts a new twist on the classic setting.

Captain Chaos. Maria Mercurial. The Laughing Man. Sally Tsung. JetBlack. Hatchetman. Nightfire. And the Shadowland poster who just called himself The Big “D.” These people and many others are waiting for you in the year that started it all, a setting brought back to life with new, full-color artwork showing the chrome, dirt, neon, and darkness that was in the heart of Shadowrun when it started and remains at its core today.

German Version
The German version has been updated to use Shadowrun 5th edition rules. Furthermore, a new chapter is added detailing the events of the Dragonfall computer game.

this Shadowrun 2050 is for use with Shadowrun 5th Edition.

Escape: La Malediction du Temple – Queenie 5: Salles des Quêtes
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Queenie 5: Cámaras de Búsqueda
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Queenie 5: Quest Chambers
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Queenie 5: Quest Kamers
boardgame.description:
Queenie 5 for Escape. 3 new quest chambers (chaos chamber, constellation chamber and snake pit) and 3 new curses (mind control, pitfall and magical bond)

Chaos Chamber - All adventurers must be in this chamber at the same time and draw 1 curse each to complete this task.

Constellation Chamber - All players must be in the corresponding chambers and roll 2 keys to complete the task. A sixth player need not do anything to complete this task.
1: The Constellation Chamber
2: The Starting Chamber
3: A Triple Gem Chamber
4: A Single Gem Chamber
5: The Exit Chamber

Snake Pit - The player who discovers the snake pit takes 1 snake token for every other adventurer and adds them to each of their chambers. First all token snakes must be defeated with 2 torches while in the same chamber as the token. After that has been completed, players must defeat the mother snake in the chamber using 5 torches to complete this task.

Mind Control - You are not allowed to touch your adventurer figure, the draw pile, or gems on the depot. Other players must move them for you.

Pitfall - Immediately place your adventurer figure back in the starting chamber. Then discard this curse.

Magical Bond - You must have 1 hand touching another player at all times.

boardgame.description:
Queenie 6 for Escape. 2 new chambers (mirage chamber, gear chamber), 2 new curses (weakest link, misinformation), 3 new treasures (short cut, time out, genie lamp)

Mirage Chamber - When the Mirage Chamber is revealed, it replaces the Starting Chamber and the Starting Chamber is placed where the Mirage Chamber would have gone.

Gear Chamber - While in the chamber, players must roll 2 torches to slide 1 row or column of chamber tiles 1 space in one direction. All chambers in the row or column must move.

Weakest Link - If you aren't back in the start chamber at the end of the countdown then you all lose the game. This curse can't be lifted.

Misinformation - Every time you discover a new chamber you have to yell "I found the exit" twice.

Short Cut - When discovering a new chamber, look through the whole draw pile and choose 1. Reshuffle when finished.

Time Out - Use to pause the timer/soundtrack and plan. No rolling while paused.

Genie Lamp - Draw the top 3 treasures from the stack and choose 1. Return the others to the bottom.

boardgame.name: Arrowdown
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arrowdown is a free introduction scenario for Doctor Who Adventures in Time and Space. An unexploded bomb in the coastal village of Arrowdown opens the door to a much more terrifying mystery and a deadly adversary.

Arrowdown is intended to be a fast moving scenario to guide you through the way the game works, give each type of character a chance to shine and at the same time emphasise exactly how strange and dangerous the Doctor’s world is. There are several elements of the scenario that can go more than one way depending on what type of group you’re playing with, and the various different takes on events are explored as they come up.

There is a curse laid on everything in that place! Cursed, you hear me? Cursed!

boardgame.name: Friends & Foes
boardgame.description:
A Fantasy Team Brawler Board Game. Play as one of seven unique characters in this exciting, easy to learn game of fantasy combat.

Guided by modern game design principles:

No Player Elimination
Simultaneous Turns
One Hour Play Time
Easy to Learn and Teach
Deep Strategies


Game Play Highlights:


Play on teams and use teamwork and strategy in head to head combat.
Draft characters or deal them randomly.
Build your character by choosing your abilities before the game starts.
Play one ability per turn, simultaneously. You have access to all of your abilities every turn.
Gain and spend "focus" using your ability cards.
Reveal rune cards for bonus effects on the ability you play.
Play a "level up" ability to add a wild card to your rune deck, giving you better odds on bonus effects for the rest of the game.
Move and attack using your ability cards.
Make meaningful choices about how to spend focus such as:
Tactical Movement
Fast, high damage attacks
Level up for a late game strategy

boardgame.name: World War II Archetypes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

If you play Savage Worlds, then you know their slogan: "Fast, Furious, and Fun!" And if you play any role-playing game, you know it's all to easy to get stuck generating characters, filling out record sheets and otherwise doing paperwork. Sometimes you just want to sit down and play. Sometimes you need the characters already waiting.

Sometimes you need a Cast of Cards.

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: World War II Archetypes (Modern)

Is your player group taking on missions during World War II? These 17 Savage Worlds archetypes give you NPCs, allies and enemies that you might encounter on the battlefields!

boardgame.name: Big Time Hoops
boardgame.description:
Big Time Hoops is a fast-playing, card-based simulation of professional basketball for two players. To recreate the flow of the game and remove "housekeeping" altogether, the game eschews individual cards for basketball players and focuses exclusively on the major action elements of the sport.

In general, you'll hold a hand of three cards, most of which will be offensive in nature. You'll play one of them, choosing to pass the ball or drive to the basket; each card will result in a shot attempt with a varying degree of success. Then you'll roll a die. If the shot fails, the card states which side gets the rebound. (Yes, three-point shots are in the game.)

Your opponent can play a defensive card, and when used wisely he'll steal a pass, block a shot or foul your shooter.

Simulating realistic scoring requires a delicate balance in a sport where each team averages 100 points per game. Rest assured that you'll find it here, as the number of two-pointers, three-pointers and foul shots will be very close to their actual real-life averages each and every game.

Playable in an hour, Big Time Hoops will provide all the fun and excitement of real pro basketball -- without the high ticket prices!

Cast of Cards decks offer gamers ready-to-use Savage Worlds NPCs, monsters, and villains, complete with stats and background--you can just shuffle the deck, choose and play. Available for order on dry-erase marker-ready cards, or printable from the PDF you can download today, Cast of Cards decks save you time and effort.

Each deck offers 17 Extras (NPCs), including game stats and character backgrounds, as well as space to track Wounds in case you upgrade the Extra to a Wild Card.

About Cast of Cards: Robot City Archetypes

Robots are a part of daily life in the future, filling all kinds of roles from truck driver to military commando. If you're heading to the big city, here's 17 robots based on Archetypes presented in Savage Worlds Deluxe!

boardgame.name: Jo & Jack
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Grim City / town of quirky characters
It is very simple: Collect as many points in a same color, then you are well regarded.
Optimize your hand as soon as possible. If a player closes his hand, the fun is over!
Joker and Doubler help you while foreign Hi-Jacks poach in their own ranks and make seemingly safe points to nothing.
Turbulent, exciting and fast it goes on here - can you keep up?

excerpt of the official rules:
Each player receives 3 cards on hand. 3 more cards are placed side by side for all players on the table.
The remaining cards form a draw pile deck. The players try to collect as many points in a same suit (red, green or black).
During the game the player's hand can gradually optimized with the table cards. In each round, each player has exactly one of several possible actions.
Note: During the game each player always has 3 cards in hand and on the table are always 3 cards open.
The game is played over several singles matches. The player with the lowest result at the end of a single match, loses a credit (chip card is rotated accordingly).
The player is completely out of the game if he can not bring this stake.
Note: If several players at the same time have the lowest result (tied), each of these players lose a credit.







Willkommen in Grim-City / die Stadt der skurrilen Persönlichkeiten
Es ist ganz einfach: Sammle möglichst viele Punkte in einer gleichen Farbe, dann bist Du gut angesehen.
Optimiere Dein Blatt so schnell es geht. Macht ein Spieler dicht, ist Schluss mit lustig!
Joker und Doppler helfen Dir, während fremde Hi-Jacks in den eigenen Reihen wildern und sicher geglaubte Punkte zunichte machen.
Turbulent, spannend und schnell geht es hier zu - kannst Du mithalten?

Auszug des offiziellen Regelwerks:
Jeder Spieler erhält 3 Karten auf die Hand. 3 weitere Karten werden für alle Spieler offen nebeneinander auf den Tisch ausgelegt.
Die restlichen Karten bilden einen verdeckten Nachziehstapel.
Die Spieler versuchen möglichst viele Punkte in einer gleichen Spielfarbe zu sammeln (rot, grün oder schwarz).
Mit den ausliegenden Karten werden die eigenen Handkarten nach Bedarf im laufenden Spiel nach und nach
optimiert. Pro Runde hat jeder Spieler immer genau eine von mehreren möglichen Aktionen zur Verfügung.
Hinweis: Während des Spiels hat jeder Spieler immer 3 Karten auf der Hand und auf dem
Tisch liegen immer 3 Karten offen aus.
Das Spiel wird über mehrere Einzelspiele gespielt. Der Spieler mit dem schlechtesten Ergebnis eines
Einzelspiels verliert einen Credit (Chipkarte wird entsprechend gedreht). Der Spieler ist ganz aus dem
Spiel, wenn er diesen Einsatz nicht mehr bringen kann.
Hinweis: Haben mehrere Spieler zeitgleich das
schlechteste Ergebnis (punktgleich), verliert jeder dieser Spieler einen Credit.

boardgame.name: Almirante
boardgame.description:
English description:

"As almirantes - Portuguese for admirals - in command of both a merchant and a war navy, 2 to 6 players build and navigate their fleets in order to dominate the geostrategic center of the ocean. In this exciting strategy game, however, one must call for divine help as conquering the ocean is nothing compared to holding it…"

Each almirante has the goal of dominating the ocean, that is, conquering and holding the field in the center of both ocean and board. For that, he or she builds and sails a fleet of both fishing boats and war galleons, by cleverly using the resources received in the beginning of each play: winds and coins. In addition, each almirante has three opportunities to use a god card.

Each play starts by receiving 6 winds and a variable amount of coins. Winds allow you to move your vessels: you need 1 wind to sail a fishing boat to another field, and 2 winds to do the same with a heavier galleon. Coins allow you to build new vessels: fishing boats cost you 2 coins, while galleons cost you 8 coins. You can trade these two resources, if you are willing to pay a conversion fee.

You then move your vessels. Sail your fishing boats to the shoal fields to fish and earn coins on your next turns (2 coins per each of the 6 shoals players compete for). Sail your galleons to meet opponent vessels in order to fight battles, or go for the center to conquer it. Battles are always won by the almirante with the most galleons on that field. Some defeated vessels are sunk and some of them may flee.

If the time is right, call upon the gods! Each almirante chose 3 god cards from equal pools of 8 before the game started, kept them secret and can now play each of them once - but only once. Play Aeolus and he will grant you extra winds, or maybe play Ares and he will sink an opponent's vessel...

Your play is now over. Are your galleons dominating the center of the ocean? Good, then slide one point along the scoreboard. Do this 4 times (in a game with 3-5 players) to win. But look out, the other almirantes are now sourrunding you and will want to join efforts to stop your countdown toward victory. Will they get you?


Portuguese Description:

Enquanto almirantes, no comando tanto de uma marinha mercante como de uma de guerra, 2 a 6 jogadores constroem e dirigem as suas frotas para dominar o centro geoestratégico do oceano. Neste entusiasmante jogo de estratégia, porém, têm de apelar a uma ajuda divina já que conquistar o oceano não é nada comparado a mantê-lo...

boardgame.name: Black Powder: Rebellion!
Black Powder: Rebellion! – Fighting the Battles of the American Revolutionary War with Model Soldiers
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In 1775 the simmering resentment of American colonists exploded into a bloody rebellion. Beginning in Boston, the conflict eventually stretched from Canada in the north to Florida in the south and lasted eight grueling years. On one side stood the King's redcoats and settlers loyal to their sovereign, later joined by regiments of 'Hessian' mercenaries. Ranged against them was a citizen army under the inspirational leadership of George Washington, supported by militia and eventually French troops eager to embarrass their old foe. Both sides were forced to learn new tactics for fighting in the wild terrain of North America in a conflict that saw heroism and ineptitude in equal measure. This supplement for Black Powder describes the history, armies, personalities and battles of this conflict. Included are scenarios allowing you to recreate many of the battles of the rebellion. This glorious 144-page full-color book, written by Steve Jones, comes with a free Continental officer figure sculpted by Alan Perry himself! Who else would you ask to design a new figure for an American War of Independence book? A copy of the Black Powder rulebook is required to use this supplement.

boardgame.name: Franky Reloaded
boardgame.description:
Franky is back!
In a secret laboratory, the players try to assemble as many Frankies as possible and then activate them with lightning flashes. Only energy charged Frankies can score in the game.
Not every Franky is the same, the risky ’small’ red Frankies can win the most victory points ..

excerpt of the official rules:
The object of the game is to win 12 victory points or more. The highest number of victory points wins the game. In case of a tie of victory points a flash-duel (between the affected players) takes place in a special round. Note: Victory point is a funny reference to the fictional character Victor Frankenstein.
How to play: Each game round the player has a regular dice turn with multiple number of rolls. After each roll, any number of dice can be laid aside, but at least 1 die is always required! Dice which are laid aside cannot be re-rolled in this round. At the end of the regular dice turn (all dice are laid aside) the result is evaluated. A lightning flash symbolizes a victory point, but only if the player can assemble a complete Franky in a same color (2 other dice in green or according violet). A green or violet Franky is always assembled with a head and a body.
Note: If you want to achieve a regular victory point this way, always 3 dice are necessary.
Red Frankies: After the player has completed his regular dice turn (all dice are laid aside), all red Frankies are rolled once again. Here the player has gained special chances with these dice. A red Franky can immediately achieve victory points if he shows a flash after the rolling (the red Franky has been activated). Here no assembly with other dice is required because the red Franky is already complete (custom-made). Displays the die (after the roll) again a red Franky, he will be re-rolled again, all other symbols do not help anymore.
Note: If the player wins victory points this way, only 1 single die is necessary. Depending on how many red Frankies the player has laid aside, a lot of victory points can be earned.

excerpt of the official rules Blue Eyes (included first expansion):
The player can try to score victory points as usual. If he plays a total of victory points that is similar with the number the blue spot die shows, the victory points can be doubled. Note: The player can decide to devaluate any number of victory points to fulfill the spot die (only
complete activated Frankies can be devaluated).







Franky ist zurück!
Im geheimen Labor versuchen die Spieler möglichst viele Frankys zusammenzubauen und diese dann mit Energieblitzen zu aktivieren. Nur energiegeladene Frankys können im Spiel punkten.
Nicht jeder Franky ist gleich, die riskanten „kleinen” roten Frankys können die meisten Siegpunkte erspielen ..

Auszug des offiziellen Regelwerks:
Spielziel sind 12 Siegpunkte oder mehr. Die höchste Anzahl an Siegpunkten gewinnt das Spiel. Bei Gleichstand von Siegpunkten wird ein Blitz-Duell in einer Sonderrunde ausgetragen.
Spielüberblick: Pro Spielrunde hat der Spieler einen regulären Würfeldurchgang mit mehreren Würfen. Nach jedem Wurf können beliebig viele Würfel rausgelegt werden, mindestens 1 Würfel ist aber immer Pflicht! Rausgelegte Würfel können in dieser Runde nicht wieder neu mitgewürfelt werden. Erst am Ende des regulären Würfeldurchgangs (alle Würfel sind rausgelegt) wird das Ergebnis gewertet. Ein Energieblitz bedeutet einen Siegpunkt, welcher aber erst durch den Zusammenbau von einem Franky in einer gleichen Farbe (2 andere Würfel in grün oder entsprechend violett) gewertet werden kann. Ein grüner oder violetter Franky wird immer zusammengebaut mit Kopf und Rumpf.
Hinweis: Soll auf diese Weise ein regulärer Siegpunkt erzielt werden, sind dafür immer 3 Würfel notwendig.
Rote Frankys: Nachdem der Spieler seinen regulären Würfeldurchgang abgeschlossen hat (alle Würfel sind rausgelegt), werden alle roten Frankys einmalig erneut gewürfelt; der Spieler hat sich bei diesen Würfeln Sonderchancen erspielt. Ein roter Franky kann sofort Siegpunkte erzielen, wenn er jetzt nach dem würfeln einen Energieblitz zeigt (der rote Franky wurde aktiviert). Hier ist kein Zusammenbau mit anderen Würfeln erforderlich, da die roten Frankys schon komplett sind (Sonderanfertigungen). Zeigt der Würfel (nach dem würfeln) erneut einen roten Franky, wird dieser als Wiederholung erneut gewürfelt, alle anderen Symbole bringen nichts mehr.
Hinweis: Sollen also so Siegpunkte erspielt werden, ist hierfür nur 1 einziger Würfel notwendig. Auf diese Weise können beliebig viele Siegpunkte erspielt werden, je nachdem wie viele rote Frankys der Spieler rausgelegt hat.

Auszug des offiziellen Regelwerks Blue Eyes (enthaltene erste Erweiterung):
Der Spieler kann ganz normal auf Siegpunkte spielen. Schafft er es jedoch genau so viele Siegpunkte zu erspielen, wie der Augenwürfel zeigt, können die Siegpunkte verdoppelt werden.
Hinweis: Der Spieler kann sich entscheiden Siegpunkte verfallen zu lassen (nur komplett aktivierte Frankys können verfallen), damit der Augenwürfel erfüllt werden kann.

boardgame.name: BETA Men
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The BETA Men Need You!

In the shadows of World War II, another war is being fought. This is a war the public know nothing about… a war that threatens all of mankind. Invaders from beyond space have set their sights on our planet, and it’s going to take superheroes to stop them!

Only one team of operatives is equipped to handle trouble like this: The BETA Men! A team of special forces dedicated to investigating and countering threats from outside, the BETA men are ready for anything. But they’ll need the help of some superheroes to get the job done.

The BETA Men is written by Jack Norris for the Mutants and Masterminds Third Edition Role Playing Game. Artwork is provided by Alex Williamson and Denise Jones. Included you’ll find an extensive brief on the Bureau of Extra-Terrestrial Affairs (BETA), summarizing their membership, history, and equipment. Everyone from leader Dash Freeman to the intellectual super-simian Professor Trinazet is given spotlight status with full stat blocks and entries.

Also inside are the guidelines for running an Invasion campaign, breaking everything down into stages. An innovative Victory Point system helps give the players a currency they can use to help determine the course of the campaign.

Finally, we outline three example sets of invaders. Will you confront the Lokkus Horde and their horrifying biotech, the mysterious size-changing threat of the Triffling Empire, or the self-proclaimed master super-race of Das Übermen? You’ll find histories, artwork, motives, plot seeds, and artwork for each set of invaders. Each one can be a campaign on their own, or string them together for a mega-sized campaign to save the earth on multiple fronts!

Join forces with the BETA men, and take a stand for all of humanity!

We’re Watching the Skies!

boardgame.name: Reign of Ruin (13th Age)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beware The Blackener Of Bright Waters, For She Is Come Again

Rumors of death move like a plague through the Crannogtowns of the Great Swamp—of ranger patrols mysteriously disappearing on routine scouting missions, of a winged shadow that blots out the midday sun, and of entire villages slaughtered, their homes left burning and the victims’ flesh melted from their bones. All evidence gathered from the sites of these massacres points to the heart of the Great Swamp, where an ancient and primitive tribe of lizardmen have ruled from an abandoned human temple for centuries on end. The Crannogtowns’ protectors, the Stormhammer Rangers, warn that horrid half-dragon monstrosities still stalk the bogs and travelers would do well to stay away from the inner swamp. Yet the killing and the carnage continue, and the people of the Crannogs plead for heroes to aid them now as they did in days long forgotten. Are you up to the challenge?

Reign Of Ruin is the first full-length adventure module in Jon Brazer Enterprises’ Deadly Delves product line, and is compatible with the ENnie-award winning 13th Age Roleplaying Game. This adventure is designed to challenge five 4th-level PCs like no other content has to date. Inside this volume, you’ll find:

More than 20 fully-developed new monsters for your 13th Age campaign
Eight new traps and eight new magic items waiting to be discovered, ranging from the entertaining to the awe-inspiring
Full-color maps of a Crannogtown village, as well as five floors of a terrifying temple dungeon
Story hooks that help GMs tie their players’ characters directly into the adventure using the Icon system
Specialized advice on playing a cunning black dragon against a group of PCs in a dangerous game of cat and mouse
Optional rules for using tactical terrain in select encounters
Enough content to take five 4th-level PCs from the Adventurer to Champion tier of play, with ideas to extend the story even further once you’re done exploring the temple


Dangers Unknown. Treasures Untold. Adventure Awaits.

boardgame.name: Coloratura
boardgame.description:
Coloratura won both First Place and Miss Congeniality in the 2013 Interactive Fiction Competition. The game was featured on Rock, Paper, Shotgun, and lauded by Emily Short, among others. It has been nominated for XYZZY awards, awaiting voting.

Coloratura wove together music, science, and horror to create a truly unique piece of beautiful and terrifying art. Designing in a text-only medium allowed me to stylistically build an "impossible geometry" of narrative with alien, synesthesiac descriptions. And while it was creepy and unsettling, it created strong emotional connection to players by creating empathy towards all the actors by giving them all realistic and empathetic motivations.

It was my most ambitious project yet, and I worked hard towards its completion. I had to be disciplined with scheduling, flexible to change, and good at networking to get more eyes on the game. I've fully documented all the things I learned about project management, writing, and networking on my game commentary blog.

In the past, I've innovated inside the interactive fiction community with the inclusion of a "commentary mode" where players could replay the game and read commentary as the progressed. In Coloratura, I innovated with a post-endscreen "Epilogue" option, which offered players additional content and kept players emotionally invested in continuing gameplay. Using a post-endscreen Epilogue (as opposed to a pre-endscreen Epilogue) offered a more concrete satisfaction endpoint earlier in the game, which was designed to match the external needs of the competition that has a timed judging period.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Cosmic Threats: A Bestiary of Alien Creatures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Close Encounters of Every Kind!

Whether you’re encountering them on a distant planet in a far-off nebula, or they’ve come to you, and are abducting innocent villagers for nefarious purposes, there’s nothing quite like a strange, alien race to help breathe some life into your galaxy—and your game. Some Pathfinder products have explored the idea of alien life in the past, and space ships and ray-guns have had their place in fantasy roleplaying games nearly from the beginning. This book, however, is devoted entirely to populating the stars with strange, terrible, and fascinating alien races of every sort, who can serve to breathe life into your game. Since most of these creatures will fit into the average fantasy dungeon at least as well as the froghemoth, the violet fungus, and the roper, even those who aren’t interested in the stars can still find plenty of use for the creatures in this tome.

From the insectoid, spindly-legged, and yet somehow graceful baaji (CR 12) known for impaling their victims on massive horns and treated as livestock by a variety of alien races, to the inscrutable zadar (CR 8), a race of grey-skinned humanoids with a wide variety of impressive alien technology, and mysterious, unknown goals, this book contains creatures of every CR from 1 to 20. The terrani (CR 1), a race of insectoid aliens driven into frenzy by hunger and lacking higher intelligence, are largely harmless when encountered individually, but if allowed to form into terrible terrani broods (CR 8) they can become a serious threat. The phase slime (CR 15) on the other hand is a bizarre phenomenon, whose body actually serves as a gateway to another dimension. All these creatures and many more can be found within this tome!

boardgame.name: Opération Commando: Pegasus Bridge
boardgame.description:
(Version française ci-dessous.)

In 1944, during the night of 5th to 6th June, paratroopers of the British 6th Airborne achieved three heroic missions that made possible the D-Day Normandy Landings on the East sector (Gold, Juno and Sword beaches).
In Operation Commando - Pegasus Bridge, one player leads the English commandos, while his opponent is in charge of the defending German troops.

Each turn, on a different battlefield (each ground having specific characteristics), players draw cards (each player has his own deck), can play events, and then an assault begins. The German plays a unit; the English answers with a unit, that must have a Combat value equal or higher than the German unit's, or reach it thanks to boosts. If it does, the German can boost his unit, then the English, and so on until a player stops. A unit's combat value can be raised by combat action cards and tokens (one side +1 Combat, one blank side) taken from the player's tokens reserve and flipped.
If the English's unit is destroyed, he loses one of his 3 Manpower Points (MP) but moves to the next ground (the assault ends, as does the turn on this ground). If the German's unit is destroyed, he can play another one (depending on the ground's size) and the assault goes on. If the English destroys all enemy units present on the ground, he wins the assault and progresses without losing a MP.

Players also have a pool of special cards, the powerful "heroic" cards, from which they secretely choose one card to add to their hand each two turns. Since heroic cards have potent effects and can't be countered, choosing them well depending on the situation of the game is strategically very important. These cards feature actual historical officers and events.

The game contains three scenarios, each of which corresponding to one of the three missions that the English commandos had to fulfill this night: the taking of the bridge of Bénouville ("Pegasus Bridge") to allow the landed troops to progress deeper inside the land; the assault on the Merville Gun Battery, a fortified area threatening the Landind beaches with long distance cannons; and the bombing of the bridges on the Dives river to prevent the tanks of the 21th Panzer Division from reinforcing the German troops. Each scenario has its own pool of cards (including heroic cards) and different gameplays.

To win, the English must fulfill his objective (which depends of the scenario), by winning the assault on one or more objective grounds. To win, the German has to prevent the English to reach his goal, generally by bringing his Manpower Points to zero or, in the Dives scenario, by preventing him to destroy two bridges out of four.

The three scenarios can be played in campaign mode (one after the other) to recreate the historic night. Depending on his results, the English gets more or less campaign points, and when the three scenarios have been played, his total score indicates if the D-Day Landing will be possible or not.

The 120 artworks illustrating the cards are realistic and faithful to historical documents (uniforms, weapons, locations...)

---

En 1944, pendant la nuit du 5 au 6 juin, les parachutistes de la 6e Division Aéroportée Britannique ("6th Airborne") accomplirent trois missions héroïques qui permirent au Débarquement d'avoir lieu sur le secteur est (plages Gold, Juno et Sword).
Dans **Opération Commando - Pegasus Bridge**, l'un des joueurs dirige les commandos anglais, et son adversaire les troupes allemandes.

À chaque tour, sur un champ de bataille différent (chaque terrain possédant des caractéristiques spécifiques), les joueurs piochent des cartes (chacun a sa propre pioche), peuvent jouer des événements, puis un assaut commence. L'Allemand joue une unité ; l'Anglais répond par une unité, qui doit avoir une valeur de combat égale ou supérieure à celle de l'unité allemande, ou l'atteindre grâce à des bonus. Si c'est le cas, l'Allemand peut renforcer son unité, puis l'Anglais peut faire de même, et ainsi de suite jusqu'à ce qu'un joueur renonce. La valeur de combat d'une unité peut être augmentée grâce à des actions de combat et des jetons (avec une face +1 et une face sans bonus) pris dans la réserve du joueur et jetés en l'air comme un pile ou face.
Si l'unité de l'Anglais est détruite, il perd l'un de ses 3 Points d'Effectifs (PE) mais avance jusqu'au prochain terrain (l'assaut se termine, de même que le tour sur ce terrain). Si c'est l'unité de l'Allemand qui est détruite, ce dernier peut en jouer une autre (selon la taille du terrain) et l'assaut se poursuit. Si l'Anglais élimine toutes les unités ennemies présentes, il remporte l'assaut et progresse sans perdre de PE.

Les joueurs disposent également d'une réserve de cartes spéciales, les puissantes cartes "héroïques", réserve dans laquelle ils choisissent secrètement une carte qu'ils ajoutent à leur main tous les deux tours. Les cartes héroïques ayant des effets puissants et ne pouvant être annulées, bien les choisir en fonction du déroulement de la partie est stratégiquement très important. Ces cartes représentent des officiers ayant réellement pris part aux opérations et des événements s'étant effectivement produits.

Le jeu propose trois scénarios, chacun d'eux correspondant à l'une des trois missions que les commandos anglais devaient accomplir cette nuit-là : la prise du pont de Bénouville ("Pegasus Bridge") pour permettre aux troupes débarquées de progresser à l'intérieur des terres ; l'assaut sur la batterie de Merville, une zone fortifiée menaçant les plages du Débarquement avec des canons à longue portée ; et la destruction des ponts sur la rivière Dives pour empêcher les blindés de la 21e Panzer Division de venir renforcer les troupes allemandes. Chaque scénario possède ses propres cartes (dont les cartes héroïques) et des mécaniques de jeu différentes.

Pour gagner, l'Anglais doit remplir sa mission (qui dépend du scénario), en remportant l'assaut sur un ou plusieurs terrains objectifs. Pour gagner, l'Allemand doit empêcher l'Anglais d'atteindre son but, généralement en lui faisant perdre tous ses Points d'Effectifs, ou, dans le scénario de la Dives, en l'empêchant de détruire deux des quatre ponts.

Les trois scénarios peuvent être joués à la suite, en mode "campagne", pour recréer cette nuit historique. En fonction de ses résultats, l'Anglais obtient plus ou moins de points de campagne, et quand les trois scénarios ont été joués, son score total indique si le Débarquement sur les plages de Gold, Juno et Sword pourra avoir lieu ou non.

Les 120 illustrations de cartes sont réalistes et fidèles aux documents historiques (uniformes, armes, lieux...)

boardgame.name: Flat Cube
boardgame.description:
Flat Cube is a solo card game consisting of six cards with a picture of half a coloured cube on each side, which will form a whole cube when placed next to the correct side of another card.

The player shuffles the cards then places them face up in a row. The aim of the game is to make all the cards line up with matching cubes (except for the two on either end, which will only match on one side).

In order to do this, the player must pull two (and only two) side-by-side cards out from the row and move them to an available slot — either on one end or in a space created by moving two previous cards. Continue doing this until the objective is complete, leaving no spaces and moving only two cards at any one time.

boardgame.name: Life in the West
boardgame.description:
User Summary

In this game you play as Kanye West. On twitter. You will compose tweets (pressing keyboard) and then post them. The faster you compose and post the tweets the more Kanye points you earn. With Kanye points you can follow other entities on twitter such as: fake Kanye, Waldo, Spam Bot, Barrack Obama, Fake Bear Facts, Taylor Swift and more. You don't actually choose what posts to make. Whatever keystrokes you enter in are interpreted by the game as the next in a preset text.

boardgame.name: Song of Drums and Tomahawks
boardgame.description:
Do you dare enter into the dark woodlands of early America?

The boom of a flintlock musket, a cloud of acrid black powder, and the drumming of feet as they rush towards the fallen foe. A knife is unsheathed, and with a few quick movements, the enemy’s bloody scalp is ripped free. Warfare in the Eastern Woodlands of America was one of raids, ambushes and sudden violent encounters. These are the skirmishes that Song of Drums and Tomahawks seeks to recreate. The French & Indian War is the most well-known conflict of this period, but these rules cover from the time of the European arrival until the mid-1800s. Players will generally control less than a dozen figures in multiplayer games, perhaps more in one-on-one contests. The fast-paced play, the tense decision making using simple, easy-to-learn rules, will lead to many fun and gripping games.
